name: dtrucor

body.origin:
|- wne(cv(s0), cv(s1))
-| wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
-| wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wne(cv(s0), cv(s1))
-| wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
-| wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))

body.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
-| wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wne(cv(s0), cv(s1))
-| wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))
-| wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))

|- wne(cv(s0), cv(s1))
-| wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))
-| diffss(s0, s1)

comment: Corollary of ~ dtru . This example illustrates the danger of blindly trusting the standard Deduction Theorem without accounting for free variables: the theorem form of this deduction is not valid, as shown by ~ dtrucor2 . (Contributed by NM, 27-Jun-2002.)
